title: Affärsområdeschef Security
description:
Vill du leda framtidens säkerhetspaketeringar samt säkerhetskonsulttjänster hos oss!  

Är du en visionär ledare med en passion för säkerhet och en stark affärsförståelse? Vill du stå i spetsen för att forma framtidens säkerhetslösningar och samtidigt bygga framgångsrika team och affärsrelationer? Nu söker vi en affärsområdeschef för Security till vårt dynamiska och växande team!

**Vad vi erbjuder**  

Hos oss får du en roll som gör skillnad – på riktigt. Vi erbjuder en plattform där dina idéer och din expertis uppskattas och tas tillvara. Här är några av fördelarna med att jobba hos oss:


Del av ledningsgruppen med stor påverkan på IP-Solutions framgång. Ditt fokus blir säkerhetsområdet, men som medlem i ledningsgruppen förväntas du jobba med hela IP-Solutions.


Frihet att påverka strategi, produktutveckling och affärsplanering.


Arbeta med ett befintligt fungerande och engagerat team.


Marknadsmässiga förmåner och möjlighet till personlig utveckling.


Vi värnar om gemenskap och trivsel – från hackathons och AW:s till utomhusäventyr och spelkvällar. Hos oss handlar det inte bara om att arbeta, utan också om att ha kul tillsammans!  

  

**Din roll**  

Som Affärsområdeschef för Security blir du en nyckelperson och skall även bidra i övriga ledningsfrågor som medlem i ledningsgruppen. Du rapporterar till VD. Du får möjlighet att leda och utveckla vårt affärsområde för säkerhetstjänster – både strategiskt och operativt. Teamet inom säkerhet jobbar både med informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet där vi levererar paketerade lösningar och konsulter. Till din hjälp kommer du ha fokuserad säljare som säljer konsulter och paketerade lösningar inom säkerhet.


Vad du kommer att göra:


Genomföra egna konsultuppdrag inom säkerhetslösningar.


Leda och utveckla affärsområdet Security med fokus på tillväxt och innovation.


Utforma och leverera kundanpassade paketerade lösningar baserade på den senaste säkerhetsteknologin.


Ansvara för budget, affärsplanering och resultat.


Teamleader med medarbetaransvar: rekrytera, Inspirera, coacha och utveckla teamet för att nå gemensamma mål.


Bidra till vår pågående resa mot att bli mer lösningsorienterade och tex bygga vidare på de produkter/POC:ar vi har inom säkerhet

**Vi söker dig som**  

Du är en engagerad och målinriktad ledare med gedigen erfarenhet inom säkerhetsbranschen. Med en unik kombination av teknisk förståelse och affärsstrategi är du redo att ta nästa steg i karriären.


Dina kvalifikationer och erfarenheter: Ditt cv innehåller till exempel några av följande delar:


Dokumenterad ledarskapserfarenhet inom säkerhetsområdet.


Ledningssystem, lagar och förordningar inom IT- och informationssäkerhet (t.ex. ISO27K, CIS, NIS2, GDPR).


Teknisk kompetens inom säkerhetsarkitektur, hotanalys, sårbarhetsskanning och pentester.


Förmåga att bygga och leda starka team som levererar resultat.


Kunskap om IT-säkerhet, grundläggande förståelse för nätverksarkitektur, Cloud security

**Personliga egenskaper och erfarenheter**


Högskole-/universitetsutbildning eller motsvarande


Stort kontaktnät och/eller lätt att knyta nya kontakter inom IT- och informationssäkerhetsbranschen.


Gärna kontaktnät med kunder (du kommer ha med dig en säljansvarig och säljteam som stöttar försäljningen)


Du har ett genuint intresse för människor och drivs av att få dina medarbetare att växa.  

  

**Om IP-Solutions**  

Vi är ett teknikdrivet och personalägt konsultbolag i Stockholm som brinner för IT, Säkerhet och gemenskap. Hos oss står kompetens, nyfikenhet, engagemang och trivsel i fokus - vi tror på frihet under ansvar, nära samarbeten och långsiktiga relationer med både kunder och kollegor.
  

  

**Så här ansöker du**
  

Är du redo att ta nästa steg? Skicka in ditt CV och personliga brev till maria.midell@ip-solutions.se. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Har du frågor? Kontakta Glenn Sernbrandt, VD, på 0708 88 00 64, glenn.sernbrandt@ip-solutions.se.
  

  

Vänligen men bestämt, så har vi bestämt val av annonsplats och kommer rekrytera själva direkt och vill inte ha kontakt med säljare av annonser eller rekryteringstjänster.

title: Product Manager AWS
description:
G+D makes the lives of billions of people around the world more secure. We shape trust in the digital age with built-in security tech in three segments: Digital Security, Financial Platforms and Currency Technology. We have been a reliable partner for our customers for over 170 years with our innovative solutions for SecurityTech! We are an international technology group and traditional family business with over 14,000 employees in 40 countries. Creating Confidence is our path to success. Trust is the basis of our collaboration within G+D.
   

  

 We are the reliable partner for all challenges resulting from the Internet of Things. We offer a complete connectivity portfolio for mobile network operators, automotive manufacturers, technology companies such as chip and module manufacturers as well as transport and logistics providers. Our portfolio includes highly secure solutions in the area of connectivity & IoT, from classic SIM, eSIM and iSIM, to the associated embedded operating systems and life cycle management, through to services for global connectivity and IoT solutions. Do you want to actively shape the digital transformation with us?
   

  

 Give yourself an outstanding opportunity to develop and form your career in a dynamic and international environment. We are now looking for an Product Manager with focus on cloud transformation in AWS to join us at G+D Mobile Security for a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Join our team to lead cutting-edge B2B software solutions trusted by global leaders in telecom, automotive, and IoT. As Product Manager AWS, you’ll shape the future of digital services by driving cloud transformation and scalable product strategies on AWS. Your expertise in AWS migrations will be key to delivering innovative, cloud-native solutions that set industry standards.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 We are looking for a Product Manager with strong AWS expertise, cloud migration experience, and knowledge of IoT and eSIM technologies to drive transformational projects and optimize our cloud infrastructure. In this role you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading the product lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring seamless transitions.
* Innovate business models for new digital offerings and support it with business cases.
* Craft and execute product strategies that drive sustainable growth.
* Transform business vision into product reality by understanding market dynamics and customer needs.
* Design product concepts, manage backlogs, develop roadmaps, and coordinate agile plans with cross-functional teams.
* Prioritize and review requirements to ensure market acceptance and customer value.
* Drive successful product development and growth initiatives to meet market, technical, financial and schedule requirements.


**Qualifications**
 We are looking for a dynamic leader with exceptional communication skills and a strong commercial mindset. In this role, you will guide the team into the cloud environment, which includes inspiring and motivating others, delivering presentations, and staying attuned to market trends. A deep understanding of AWS is essential, as the role has a strong focus on cloud technologies. Moreover, you need to have:
   

  

* University or Master's degree in Engineering, Economics, or Computer Science.
* Experience in Product Management or related roles in Software Engineering or Solution Architecture within IT, Software, or Telecommunications.
* Proven experience in product management for B2B software solutions
* Expertise in AWS Marketplace and also other major cloud providers
* Proficiency in Business English


 It is extra good if you have:
   

  

* Cloud provider certifications in AWS
* Experience using AI in a business context


 Do you want to contribute to build the future for a seamless and connected society? Then apply today!
   

  

**What can we offer you?**
 In this role you will have the opportunity to work with talented people in an international and innovative environment. G+D is a well-established family-owned company at the forefront of the market. Besides a dynamic and evolving industry, we offer you:
   

  

* Annual wellness allowance of 4500 SEK
* Three additional days off per year
* Weekly sport activity hour
* Collective agreement
* Access to the Benify Portal for health activities and discounts
* Skandia health insurance
* Vacation exchange program
* Hybrid office model with the option to work 50% from home
* Weekly breakfast at the office


 Get to know us and our team at G+D Sweden better by listening to our Jobcast below:Shaping the next chapter of the digital ageSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/71GyhbDv090LgVyukyLf7v?si=f399b1f0d93e47e3
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e072f95211700118d82a4Our DNA is in our peopleSpotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/6BpWiUCMXr3q68dSGEr2w7?si=e4328a3c8db34b8d
   

  

 Acast: https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e070580b8d100110f0e95

title: IT-Projektledare
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Har du erfarenhet av projektledning, förändringsledning, IT och infrastruktur? Inspireras du av att få jobba med flera spännande kunder där ditt jobb gör skillnad? Då vill jag lära känna dig!
   

  

 Mitt namn är Jelena Lazarevic och jag ansvarar för Projektledarteamet på Telia Cygate Region Öst. Nu söker vi en ny kollega till vårt team som vill vara med på en tillväxt- och förändringsresa tillsammans med oss och våra kunder mot en digital infrastruktur. Kanske är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**
 Som IT-Projektledare arbetar du nära våra kunder, vår säljorganisation och våra levererande organisationsdelar med att kvalitetssäkra och säkerställa ett strukturerat projektgenomförande. Du är en del i en grupp bestående av Projektledare och du kommer leda projekt av högt tekniskt innehåll. Till din hjälp har du våra IT-infrastrukturspecialister inom nätverk, säkerhet och hybrida IT-lösningar/cloud.
   

  

 Exempel på det du kommer att göra:
   

  

* Planera, genomföra och styra viktiga kundprojekt enligt plan och budget med ett högt kvalitetstänk
* Medverka och driva vidareutvecklingen av våra processer för hur vi bedriver projekt
* Agera rådgivande åt våra säljare i pågående dialoger avseende kommande projekt
* Vid behov driva interna transformationsprojekt


 Projektledning inom Telia Cygate:
   

  

 Dina framtida kollegor har gedigen erfarenhet från projektledning samt IPMA- och PMI-certifieringar på olika nivåer. I våra leveransprojekt arbetar vi utifrån projekt- och förändringsmetodik som bygger på vår erfarenhet från branschen och erkända standarder för projektledning. Det är inte heller ovanligt att vi använder oss av våra kunders projektprocesser.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Att knyta nya kontakter och utveckla ditt professionella nätverk tror vi är naturligt för dig. Som person söker vi dig som har ett öppet förhållningssätt och skapar en god atmosfär i dina projekt tillsammans med din projektgrupp och dina kunder. Du har dessutom förmågan att anpassa din projektledarstil mot rådande omständigheter i dina projekt. Du jobbar strukturerat, proaktivt och prioriterar väl för att hålla projektmål. Du kan leda dig själv och andra att uppnå uppsatta projektmål, där du har ett ”vi”-tänk”, och vill bidra till ett bra samarbetsklimat. Du är lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ.
   

  

 Dina erfarenheter:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av att leda IT-projekt inom infrastruktur/IT
* Förmågan av att snabbt sätta dig in i nya kundprojekt och förstå helheten samt de behov som finns
* Van att orientera dig inom flera nivåer av en organisation och hantera många kontaktytor, både operativt och strategiskt
* Stark ledarskaps- och kommunikationsförmåga
* God teknisk förståelse av IT-lösningar, system och infrastruktur
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult
* Meriterande med certifieringar inom projektledning


**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!
   

  

**Låter det intressant? Ansök!**
 Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team. Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Sista ansökningsdag är
 **2025-08-31**
 Placeringsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna på jelena.lazarevic@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våran rekryteringsprocess. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Network Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Do you want to work in one of the most exciting and complex areas of telecom technology? At Telia, we’re at the heart of ongoing transformation, and Voice Core and Telco Cloud are key areas in that journey. I’m Tomas Pöhnert, unit leader in Voice Core Networks within Group Technology, and I invite you to become part of a world-class team that thrives on collaboration, curiosity, and deep technical passion.
   

  

**As a Network Engineer…**
 We are an easy-going unit of people who are passionate about voice technology, services, and customers. Our team of 15 engineers has different skills and backgrounds, and we work together across 2G/4G/5G, IMS, Network Slicing, Telco Cloud, and beyond. We are looking for curious, knowledge-driven individuals with some telco experience who are ready to grow into the next generation of telecom experts.
   

  

 In this role, you will work in an international and cross-country setting, collaborating closely with engineers, architects, developers, and vendors. You will be part of a collaborative, learning-focused team that values growth, impact, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For…**
 You will contribute to the configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of mobile voice core systems and participate in development and design of new services. You will collaborate with suppliers and other technical teams on fault analysis and solution delivery. Over time, you will also contribute to automation, agile practices, and quality improvements. We offer full onboarding, and support from experienced team members — while also expecting you to grow into autonomy, take initiative, and shape our future. On-call support rotation may be part of the role in later stages.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who’s eager to grow, enjoys exploring new technologies, and thrives in a collaborative environment. You might not tick every technical box yet, but you bring a solid foundation and a desire to become an expert in Voice Core. You are customer-focused, committed, and ready to take long-term ownership of your role.
   

  

 You likely have around 5 years of experience in telecom or a related field, with a background in mobile networks, system operations, or cloud infrastructure. You are comfortable using scripting or automation to improve systems, and you’re motivated to learn more about virtualized and cloud-native network functions. You are familiar with agile ways of working and fluent in English (spoken and written). Most importantly, you are someone who is driven, humble, and ready to grow.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-08-31. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me Tomas Pöhnert at tomas.pohnert@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Projektledare inom infrastruktur och lokalförsörjning, Lokalplaneringsenhet Mitt, placering Kungsängens garnison
description:
**Projektledare (kravställare) infrastruktur och lokalförsörjning Kungsängens garnison**
 Trivs du med att kravställa och kvalitetssäkra funktioner i olika typer av bygg- och fastighetsprojekt?Försvarsmakten (FM) och LplE växer och nu söker vi dig som vill arbeta i rollen som projektledare med fokus på ombyggnationer och anpassningar samt nybyggnationer inom vår region. Vill du vara med och utveckla infrastrukturen i Försvarsmakten- välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Om enheten**
 Lokalplaneringsenheterna (LplE) är en del av Försvarsmaktens lokalförsörjningskompetens och företräder FM som beställare gentemot Fortifikationsverket (FORTV) och Försvarets Materielverk (FMV).
   

  

 Lokalplaneringsenhet Mitt, som består av ca 34 medarbetare, har ett geografiskt ansvarsområde som omfattar Stockholms-, Gävleborgs, Södermanlands-, Uppsala-, Västmanland-, Dalarnas- och Gotlands län. Enhetens uppgift är att stödja organisationsenheterna i garnisonerna; Arboga, Haninge, Enköping, Visby, Kungsängen, Stockholm/Solna, Uppsala, Vällinge och Falun med garnisonsplanering, anskaffning, avveckling samt vidmakthållande av mark och lokaler. LplE stödjer även Högkvarteret med underlag för planering och verksamhetsuppdrag och framtagning av styrande dokument.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Inom Försvarsmakten har man valt att benämna projektledarrollen objektledare. Objektledning innebär att vara Försvarsmaktens ansvarige under hela anskaffningsprocessen; från att leda behovsutredning och ta fram behovsunderlag till att kvalitetssäkra beställt objekt under projektering, byggskede och tillträde.
   

  

 Du kommer främst vara objektledare vid nybyggnationer samt ombyggnationer/ anpassningar inom Kungsängens garnison. I arbetsuppgifterna är en stor del att sammanhålla kontakter med olika enheter inom Försvarsmakten och berörda myndigheter.
   

  

 Arbetet är självständigt med stort eget ansvar där du leder projektgrupper och har en stor mängd personkontakter. I din roll som objektledare kommer ditt sinne för samarbete, resultat, kvalitet, struktur, prioritering samt goda förmåga till dokumentation väl till sin rätt.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Högskoleexamen inom byggteknisk eller annan relevant utbildning, alternativt aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet på minst ett par år som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att projektleda/arbeta i projektform
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i både tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i MS Office
* B-körkort (manuell växellåda)


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta självständigt, varierat och med stort eget ansvar för flera projekt samtidigt. Du är duktig på att arbeta strukturerat, prioritera och ta egna initiativ. Du trivs i en arbetsmiljö där man arbetar efter tydliga processer och mot tydliga mål, samtidigt som du är lösningsorienterad och kreativ när det behövs. Du har lätt för och trivs med tempoväxling och du är uthållig och leveranssäker. Vidare är du en utpräglad lagspelare som både delar med dig av din kompetens och också gärna tar emot andras åsikter och erfarenheter. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av att leda flera parallella projekt
* Relevant erfarenhet av projektledning (bygg, VVS, el, IT och övrig teknik)
* God kännedom om Försvarsmakten
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet från Försvarsmaktens verksamhet


**Övrigt**
 Anställningskategori: Civil
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare, med sex månaders provanställning
   

  

 Startdatum: Snarast eller enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Placeringsort: Kungsängen
   

  

 Resor: Objekt utanför Kungsängens garnison kan förekomma. Resor genomförs normalt som dagsresor.
   

  

**För mer information om befattningen kontakta:**
 Avdelningschef Annika Rappe 072-384 01 27
   

  

**För information om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta:**
 C LplE M Ulf Berglund 070-350 04 78
   

  

**Fackliga kontaktpersoner**
 Carla Vidén (SACO/S)
   

  

 Stefan Ragnebrink (OFR/S)
   

  

 Patrik Nääs (OFR/O)
   

  

 Monika Danielsson (SEKO)
   

  

 Samtliga nås via Försvarsmaktens växel 08-514 390 00
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-09-07**
 Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ett ansökningsbrev där du bland annat motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.
   

  

**Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Försvarsmaktens webbplats.** 
 -------------------------------------------------------- Information om Försvarsmakten och det rekryterande förbandet: Vid Militärhögskolan Karlberg genomförs den grundläggande treåriga officersutbildningen tillsammans med Försvarshögskolan. Vid skolan finns dessutom Managementenheten, Veterancentrum, Försvarsmaktens enhet för Idrott och Fysisk prestationsförmåga, Lokalplaneringsenhet Mitt och Skolenheten. Varje dag och varje timme gör våra medarbetare insatser som påverkar andra människors liv, både i stort och smått, och både på hemmaplan och runt om i världen. Försvarsmakten ger dig möjlighet att utvecklas som människa och växa i din professionella roll. Vi är en ansvarstagande arbetsgivare och har en öppen organisation där vi ställer upp för varandra. I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Professionell utveckling och personlig hälsa värdesätts och uppmuntras. Det finns goda förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet, friskvård och bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Försvarsmakten tillvaratar de kvaliteter som mångfald och jämn könsfördelning tillför verksamheten. Vi välkomnar därför sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter i våra rekryteringar. En anställning hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Vanligtvis krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt 3 kap i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. I anställningen ingår även en skyldighet att tjänstgöra utomlands. Innebörden av detta varierar beroende på typ av befattning. Till ansökan om anställning ska CV och personligt brev bifogas. Om du går vidare i anställningsprocessen ska alltid vidimerade kopior av betyg och intyg uppvisas. Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.

title: Technical Product Owner
description:
Are you passionate about building impactful SaaS products and driving technical innovation? Join us as a Technical Product Owner for iBOS Connect, where you'll lead the evolution of one of our key digital offerings in smart building connectivity.
   

  

 Nordomatic is a global leader within Smart Buildings. By combining our vast experience in system integration with visionary and innovative software solutions, we are pioneers in digitalizing building management. We aim to serve our customers, people, and planet better than yesterday. We reach our goals together by enabling a strong culture, developing people and skills, and in all that we do, we believe that the more we change today, the more we can impact tomorrow.
   

  

 Today, we are over 1000 specialists in 33 offices in nine countries. We are proud to say that we are one of the world’s leading independent BMS providers.
   

  

 Cloud and SaaS offer numerous opportunities for property owners to reduce energy consumption, enhance indoor air quality, and access essential data and analytics. Nordomatic Property Tech is a lean and agile software company with large ambitions! We deliver cloud solutions for properties around the globe, bringing together hardware and software solutions to help companies manage their BMS, Workplace, and Energy in the cloud.
   

  

 Join us on our mission to create an open and sustainable future!
   

  

**About The Job**
 Location: Stockholm, Sweden, but open to options depending on the candidate.
   

  

 Team: NPT Product Team
   

  

 iBOS Connect securely connects buildings to the cloud, adding a new level of visibility and accessibility, remotely and from any device. With advanced user provisioning and powerful tools and services for facility managers, iBOS Connect facilitates digitising and automating building operations. It is already one of the market’s most intuitive tools. Now we aim to make it even more powerful and to expand our market reach.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Technical Product Owner, you are responsible for the roadmap and backlog for iBOS Connect, ensuring it provides measurable value aligned with our strategic goals. You will collaborate closely with development teams, stakeholders, and customers to shape the future of our product.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Assist in setting the goals and strategy for the global success of iBOS Connect.
* Own and develop the product roadmap and backlog for iBOS Connect.
* Translate high-level objectives into actionable user stories, journeys, and system specifications.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure technical feasibility and quality.
* Work with the product team to ensure the success of our iBOS products.
* Prioritize features based on ROI, customer value, and strategic fit.
* Support escalated customer issues and contribute to training and documentation.
* Facilitate sprint planning, backlog grooming, and delivery meetings.
* Ensure smooth delivery of epics by managing risks and tracking dependencies.
* Lead quality assurance efforts and support testing of new features.


 What You Bring
   

  

* Proven experience in technical product management, preferably within SaaS or IoT domains.
* Solid understanding of networking concepts, such as protocols, connectivity, and cloud integrations.
* Experience collaborating with agile development teams and managing product delivery cycles.
* Strong analytical skills to evaluate feature value and make data-driven decisions.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Familiarity with tools like Jira, Confluence, and product analytics platforms.
* Experience working with both monolithic and microservice-based platforms.
* Ability to facilitate rapid prototyping and design sprints to quickly validate ideas.
* Experience conducting A/B testing regionally and integrating feedback loops into product development.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience in smart buildings, automation, or energy management.
* Background in software engineering or systems architecture.
* Passion for sustainability and digital transformation.


 Why Nordomatic?
   

  

 At Nordomatic, we are at a crucial stage of our journey to become a digital and data-led enterprise. Our commitment to innovation empowers us to make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems that drive scale and speed for exponential growth. With investment backing us all the way, we are focused on disrupting the industry while making a meaningful impact through our work. Here you'll find countless opportunities to learn, grow, and contribute to developing digital products that contribute to sustainability daily.

title: Account Executive - Stockholm/Solna (Hybrid)
description:
Do you have experience managing and closing complex, value-based software sales cycles? Are you skilled at building high-value pipelines through strategic prospecting? If yes – this is a great opportunity to join an industry-leading SaaS company!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Paligo is a fast-growing Swedish Headquartered, but globally dispersed SaaS company offering a cloud-based Component Content Management System (CCMS). Our platform enables global collaboration in creating, managing, translating, and publishing technical documentation. Being that we are founded and headquartered in Sweden means we believe in a progressive and employee-centric approach to work culture. This includes valuing work-life balance, empowerment and trust, employee welfare, and consensus driven decision making.
   

  

 We serve global enterprises including Dell, Emerson Electric, Mitsubishi, and Samsara. Our mission is to become the #1 CCMS provider by delivering exceptional features, customer value, and satisfaction. Now we’re looking for a new team member to help take us even further.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an Account Executive, you’ll be responsible for full-cycle B2B sales targeting mid-market to enterprise customers. You’ll:
   

  

* Be assigned to a regional Sales Territory
* Have support from both a BDR and Solutions Engineer in territory activities
* Be assigned annual and quarterly quotas, with an enticing variable and motivating upside potential
* Build and manage a high-value pipeline through strategic outbound prospecting
* Lead complex sales cycles using a value-based, consultative approach
* Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure seamless handovers and customer experience


**About You**
 You are a driven and self-motivated Account Executive who thrives in a fast-paced environment. You have:
   

  

* 4+ years of experience in SaaS sales to mid-market or enterprise clients
* Proven success managing full sales cycles and consistently exceeding quota
* Experience prospecting and generating your own leads, bringing a true hunter’s mentality and approach
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
* A collaborative mindset – you enjoy working with cross-functional teams
* Fluent English


**Nice-to-have**
* Experience with Hubspot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Gong
* Background in CMS, CCMS, or related tools (TMS, knowledge bases, etc.)
* Fluency in an additional language


**What We Offer**
 At Paligo, you’ll be at the heart of a fast-growing, small but global dispersed SaaS company where your work makes a real impact. You’ll be challenged, supported, and given space to grow, all while working hybrid office arrangement.
   

  

 We stay connected through regular team check-ins and informal Google Meet sessions, and we believe in open communication, shared learning, and supporting each other along the way.
   

  

 We offer flexible hours, health-promoting initiatives, generous time off, annual company flybacks (locations vary) and competitive benefits — because work/life balance matters. If this sounds like a place where you'd thrive, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Paligo is an end-to-end Component Content Management System (CCMS) solution for technical documentation, policies and procedures, knowledge management, and more.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**Senior Fullstack Engineer - building real-world GenAI tools!** 




  





 If you are an experienced full-stack software engineer who loves working across everything from AI experimentation and ideation, to deploying impactful products at scale, this one may be for you!
 



  





 I'm working with an industry-leading SaaS company based in Stockholm, whose Cloud-based product is at the forefront of global team collaboration and content sharing through a powerful but lightweight UI and a focus on security and scalability!
 



  





**☁Modern SaaS on AWS - Lightweight yet powerful UI 🖌- Real‑time global collaboration 🌍** 




  





 Having established themselves as a leader in this space, with a global customer base, they are in a fantastic position but see endless opportunity to continually optimize and evolve their product offering. Despite their international presence and enterprise-grade product, they retain a small company feel where everyone has an impact. Approx 40 people in the company, with a cross functional engineering team.
 



  





 With this in mind - they are looking to make significant investment into their AI journey, building a new team focused on building various exciting GenAI tools to elevate their product to the next level!
 



  





**As a senior engineer, you will;** 




  




* Build a brand new AI infrastructure from early stage, working across the full software development and AI lifecycle from experimentation and ideation to Cloud deployment at scale!
* Build new agentic workflows leveraging the most cutting-edge technologies
* Play a significant and driving role in accelerating their AI journey, working in close collaboration with senior leadership from both product and engineering to plan, strategize and define the technical roadmap!
* Work as part of a cross-functional and super talented engineering department. You'd work across the stack and so we think you come from a background in fullstack/backend software development.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* A senior software engineer with a wealth of experience in fullstack/backend development, with a recent focus on building GenAI tools for real-world products!
* Somewhat of a generalist and a big-picture thinker where you are able to define and drive the technical roadmap alongside the management.
* Experience with: LLMs, AgenticAI, RAG, AWS, IaaC, Microservices, Typescript/Javascript; NodeJS/Python/PHP
* Fluent English speaker
* Swedish citizenship or permanent residence, EU citizenship or full right to work without requiring visa sponsorship.



  





 This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to join a mature and established product company, working on exciting engineering challenges and taking a huge degree of ownership, autonomy and freedom in this companies AI journey from early stag!
 



  





 This is a permanent role based out of their Stockholm HQ - Hybrid

title: IT-driftansvarig
description:
**Var med och säkra driften av kritiska IT-tjänster som gör pensionsinformation tillgänglig och trygg för över fem miljoner användare årligen.** 




  





**minPension är Sveriges oberoende pensionstjänst – ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen. Som IT-driftansvarig har du en central roll i att upprätthålla en stabil, säker och effektiv driftmiljö som stödjer både dagens och framtidens tjänster.** 




  





**Om rollen** 




 MinPension befinner sig i en spännande utvecklingsfas – och du har chansen att vara med och göra verklig skillnad. Nu tar de nästa steg mot framtidens plattformar för pensionsinformation: mer individanpassade, lättillgängliga och sömlöst integrerade i det digitala ekosystemet. Med över 62 miljoner prognoser per år är tjänsten en viktig del av Sveriges digitala samhällsinfrastruktur.
 



  





 Som IT-driftansvarig hos minPension tar du ansvar för att säkerställa en stabil och säker driftmiljö för deras IT-tjänster. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med externa leverantörer och interna team för att effektivt hantera incidenter, förändringar och löpande driftsleveranser. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt för att förbättra driftsprocesser och har en viktig roll i att bidra till organisationens övergripande IT-strategi.
 



  





 Hos minPension är beslutsvägarna är korta och du blir en del av ett engagerat, mindre team i en verksamhet med stor passion för uppdraget. Du har ett stort mandat inom ditt område och erbjuds alla möjligheter till att initiera, utmana, utveckla och själv utvecklas.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Säkerställa en robust och säker driftmiljö för minPensions IT-tjänster med fokus på tillgänglighet och kontinuitet
* Leda och samordna incidenthantering enligt etablerade ITIL-processer
* Driva förändringsprocessen (CAB) med riskbedömning, prioritering och godkännande
* Planera och koordinera tekniska releaser tillsammans med utveckling, verksamhet och leverantörer
* Följa upp driftavvikelser, SLA och säkerhetshändelser samt initiera förbättringsåtgärder
* Etablera och underhålla kontinuitets- och återställningsplaner (DRP) inklusive test och dokumentation
* Vara brygga mellan teknik, säkerhet och verksamhet för att skapa samstämmighet och effektivitet
* Rapportera och dokumentera från operativa forum och driftmöten
* Bidra till riskhantering och internkontroll inom IT-driftområdet



  





 Tjänsten utgår ifrån minPensions kontor i Stockholm med möjlighet att arbeta del av tiden på distans.
 



  





**Är det här du?** 




 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen är du både strategisk och operativ, en handlingskraftig do:er som snabbt sätter dig in i tekniska detaljer. Du tar ansvar, skapar struktur och trivs i en komplex miljö. Du har förmåga att bygga goda samarbeten och bidra till ett klimat där man lyckas tillsammans, vilket är särskilt viktigt i en liten och samarbetsorienterad organisation som minPension.
 



  





 Du kommunicerar tydligt och skapar förtroende mellan teknik, verksamhet och leverantörer.
 



  





**Du har:** 



* Gedigen erfarenhet av driftledning i outsourcade eller leverantörsstyrda miljöer
* Praktisk kunskap om ITIL-processer (incident-, change-, problemhantering)
* God teknisk förståelse för infrastruktur, applikationsdrift och säkerhet, gärna från mindre IT-organisationer
* Erfarenhet av att leda CAB-möten och koordinera tekniska releaser
* Förmåga att samordna mellan teknik, säkerhet och verksamhet
* Van att dokumentera och driva förbättringsarbete



**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av att införa ITSM-processer i mindre organisationer
* Kunskap om regulatoriska krav som ISO 27001, NIS2 eller erfarenhet från reglerad verksamhet



  





**Intresserad av att ansöka eller få veta mer?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar minPension med IDG Recruitment.
 



 Vid intresse eller frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Britta Liljegren, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-771 18 11, britta.liljegren@foundryco.com eller Alexandra Tihinen, Rekryteringskonsult på 070-447 92 24, alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com.
 



  





 För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin.
 



  





**Om minPension** 




*På minPension får alla som har jobbat i Sverige bättre koll på sina pensioner, oavsett kunnighet och ålder. Sedan starten 2004 har närmare 5 miljoner användare registrerat sig till tjänsten. minPension är ett samarbete mellan staten och pensionsbolagen och är ett icke-vinstdrivande bolag. Varje dag arbetar vi för att skapa oberoende och tillförlitlig pensionsinformation som är enkel och begriplig för alla. På minPension är arbetstempot högt och beroendena många. Projekten går parallellt och kräver ofta kreativitet och lösningar utanför boxen. Veckorna flyger fram och sällan är den ena dagen lik den andra.* 




  





*minPension är ett helägt dotterbolag till Svensk Försäkring, som är försäkringsföretagens branschorganisation.* 




  





*Läs gärna mer på* 
***minPension.se***

title: Supporttekniker sökes till Nordlo i Stockholm
description:
Vi på Nordlo Improve i Stockholm blir större och söker efter dig som tillsammans med oss vill vara med och leverera helhetslösningar inom IT-infrastruktur till våra kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Vi söker nu en serviceinriktad person till vårt team som supporttekniker.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Du behöver inte vara någon superhjälte eller inneha svart bälte i något teknikområde. Däremot tror vi att du som söker har ett stort intresse för IT och teknik, och ser glädjen i att få arbeta med felsökning, teknik och människor. Hos oss kommer du komma långt med en vilja att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker och vi ser att du som söker har:
   

  

* Gymnasial utbildning eller högskoleutbildning/yrkesutbildning, gärna inom IT
* Grundläggande IT-kunskaper
* Ett intresse av att lära dig nya saker


 Då flera av våra kunder använder svenska som företagsspråk behöver du behärska svenska i tal och skrift obehindrat.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I denna roll kommer du att vara företagets första kontaktpunkt för våra kunder och hantera inkommande ärenden via telefon. Du kommer att spela en avgörande roll i att hjälpa användare med tekniska problem och säkerställa att de får snabb och professionell support. Genom varierande arbetsuppgifter och olika kundmiljöer har du goda möjligheter att lära dig mycket nytt, men också stärka och utveckla din befintliga kompetens.
   

  

 Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Hantera och lösa inkommande ärenden via telefon, fjärrstyrning eller på plats
* Ge teknisk support och felsökning för våra användare
* Eskalera mer komplexa ärenden till second line support eller annan relevant avdelning
* Dokumentera och följa upp ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem
* Säkerställa att användarna får en positiv upplevelse genom ett professionellt och serviceinriktat bemötande


 Du kommer ha din hemmahamn i ett av våra leveransteam i Stockholm där du tillsammans med ett 10-tal kollegor arbetar mot ett par av våra kunder.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande, och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Vänligen skicka in certifikat, examensbevis, eller andra relevanta intyg under övriga filer.
   

  

 Då några av våra kunder är säkerhetsklassade kommer en säkerhetsintervju att genomföras i slutet av processen.
   

  

**Om Nordlo**
 Nordlo är en av Nordens ledande aktörer inom moln och infrastruktur. Vi erbjuder skalbara driftlösningar, managerade tjänster och full outsourcing av IT- och digitaliseringstjänster till företag och offentliga verksamheter. Genom nära samarbete och med ansvarsfulla val av innovativ teknik hjälper vi våra kunder att stärka sin konkurrenskraft och driva digitaliseringen framåt.
   

  

 Nordlo omsätter 2,4 miljarder SEK, har ca 1000 anställda på orter över hela Sverige och stora delar av Norge.
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och må bra i vår organisation är ditt välmående viktigt för oss. Vi tror på en mångfald och arbetar aktivt för en jämlik och inkluderande företagskultur. Som anställd hos oss kan du förvänta dig följande:
   

  

* En god balans mellan arbetstid och fritid
* En stor delaktighet och möjlighet att påverka
* Ett nära samarbete mellan team och kollegor
* Ett lyhört och närvarande ledarskap


 Vill du veta mer? På vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om våra erbjudanden.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/67 | Publicerat: 2025-08-25 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-05

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for someone with extensive experience as a
 **Machine Learning Engineer or Data Scientist** 
 to join our team in the
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Viaplay, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our data-driven products and services. Operating at the intersection of personalization, customer engagement, and operational intelligence, you'll lead the design and deployment of cutting-edge ML systems that directly impact millions of users.
   

  

 Your work will extend beyond model development, you'll be a strategic partner to stakeholders across product, tech, and commercial teams, translating business objectives into scalable ML solutions. From enhancing recommendation engines to unlocking deep user insights and enabling smarter decision-making across the organization, your contributions will be central to Viaplay’s continued growth and innovation.
   

  

 You’ll join a high-performing, inclusive, and curious team of ML Engineers, Data Scientists, Analysts, and Data Engineers. Together, we foster a culture of experimentation, knowledge-sharing, and technical excellence. Our recommender system is already powering engaging user experiences, and this is only the beginning of our machine learning journey.
   

  

**What** 
**You’ll Be Doing**
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models for recommendation, prediction, and classification tasks
* Perform advanced statistical analyses to uncover trends in user behavior, content performance, and platform usage
* Translate business challenges into structured machine learning problems and deliver measurable solutions
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, content, commercial, and marketing teams to drive strategic, data-informed decisions
* Build robust, production-ready pipelines and monitor ML systems in a cloud-native environment
* Contribute to a culture of experimentation, innovation, and continuous learning within the data team
* Take ownership and drive end-to-end machine learning projects, from ideation and stakeholder alignment to development, deployment, and post-launch evaluation
* Facilitate Data scientist/Machine learning engineer forums to share best practices and ideas


**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re looking for someone who is passionate about creating real-world impact through machine learning and thrives in a collaborative environment. You don’t have to tick every single box, if you have relevant experience and are eager to learn and grow, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Desired Skills**
* Experience working on machine learning projects end-to-end, from problem definition and stakeholder alignment to deployment and performance monitoring in production
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in applied Machine Learning or Data Science within production environments
* Familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow, enabling reliable ML pipeline execution and monitoring
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, you enjoy working with cross-functional teams and can explain technical ideas clearly to different audiences
* A focus on building ML systems that are not just performant, but also reliable, transparent, and maintainable
* Comfortable working in an agile team where priorities evolve and learning is ongoing
* Background in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience)


**It’s a bonus if you have:** 
  

  

* Experience with recommender systems, content optimization, or personalization
* Familiarity with A/B testing platforms or causal inference techniques
* Knowledge of MLOps practices like CI/CD for ML, monitoring, and observability
* Exposure to real-time or near-real-time ML architectures and streaming data systems
* Experience in media, streaming, or e-commerce environments


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Kotlin Backend Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for experienced Software Engineers to join various teams within the Merchant Group at Wolt! If you have a strong track record of building and maintaining scalable, production-grade systems and want to drive impact at scale, this is the place for you.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an engineer in our group, you’ll work on production-level microservices in Kotlin, helping shape how merchants succeed with Wolt. You’ll have opportunities to:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale reliable systems that power merchant experiences.
* Work across the full development lifecycle – from business logic and testing to cloud infrastructure and data streaming.
* Collaborate on architecture and technology choices that keep our systems simple, scalable, and efficient.
* Grow your skills and knowledge by working alongside experienced teammates in an environment that values learning and experimentation.


**How We Work**
* Autonomy & Ownership – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Collaboration – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
* Scalability & Simplicity – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.


 Find out more by checking out our Kotlin-related Tech Talks below:
   

  

* Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast
* Kotlin at Wolt
* Kotlin Meetup


**Our Tech Stack**
 Our core technologies include Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, gRPC), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 No matter your level, Wolt is a place where you can learn, teach, and grow. If you’re passionate about building great technology and working in an environment that values teamwork and autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 📍These open roles can be based in our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm and Tallinn. You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking experienced Software Engineers with a strong background in building scalable microservices. While Kotlin is our primary language, experience with Java, Scala, or other JVM backend languages is great - if you’re confident in your ability to learn, we’d love to hear from you! 🛠️
   

  

 Beyond technical expertise, we value ownership, collaboration, and a mindset for growth. You thrive in tackling complex challenges, questioning conventions, and working closely with teammates to build reliable, scalable systems. 🚀
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We are hiring for multiple open positions across different teams in the Merchant Group. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about the group. After the recruiter screening call, during the rest of the interviewing steps, you’ll meet hiring managers and software engineers from the Merchant group, a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills, and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola severi.kausola(at)wolt.com
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: SAP Senior Consultant (Ariba)
description:
At PBS Nordics, a Capgemini business unit, we empower individuals to shape their careers within a collaborative global community.
   

  

 Specializing in ERP transformation services for both public and private sectors, PBS Nordics delivers tailored solutions using top ERP systems like SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, and IFS. With a strong Nordic presence and a diverse global client portfolio, we guide organizations through seamless ERP transformations, driving operational excellence and strategic growth.
   

  

**Your role:**
 As an SAP Consultant, you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end processes through SAP Ariba, SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, and S/4 HANA, helping us improve efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer service. If you have a track record of implementing and supporting SAP solutions and are a true Team Player that is passionate about adding value to clients and want to advance your career, this could be the role for you!
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Lead and manage the delivery of comprehensive solutions based on SAP Ariba/SAP Business Network for Supply Chain Collaboration.
* Act as a strategic partner to both Ariba and SAP teams, ensuring seamless integration and collaboration.
* Act as an expert in one or more functional areas, including SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, Ariba Upstream and/or Downstream, and Ariba Supplier Lifecycle Management.
* Manage and drive cross-functional teams to successful delivery, ensuring that client requirements are met with efficiency and excellence.


**Your profile:**
* To excel in this role, we seek candidates with proven expertise in one or more of the following components: SAP Business Network for Supply Chain, SAP Ariba Supplier Management, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Integration and Extensions, SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Procurement. Valid certifications add value.
* You should have a strong track record of leading complex Ariba implementations, with the proven ability to manage multiple components effectively and efficiently.
* A passion for business development within the Ariba/SAP Business Network for Supply Chain space is considered a plus, with a knack for identifying new opportunities and driving growth.
* Experience with S/4HANA implementations and upgrades is essential, along with the ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels, serving as a trusted strategic advisor.


*Note: Nordic-based and fluency in English; proficiency in local language is preferred. Open to travel.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* A challenging career in a vibrant environment with access to extensive training, a global network of experts and an innovative culture that promotes learning, growth, and shared success.
* Opportunities to work on real-world problems and help transform leading organizations.
* A company culture driven by core values: Honesty, Trust, Freedom, Team Spirit, Modesty, Fun, and Boldness.
* A strong commitment to inclusion, diversity, and supporting the whole person


**Application**
*In this recruitment process, we review applications and hire on an ongoing basis. As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.

title: Technical Solution Owner
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Due to our continuous growth, we are hiring a Technical Solution Owner for HVDC Control & Protection Software. This is a hybrid working role, based in our Ludvika, Sweden offices, combined with working from your home-office.


You will be part of the Global Engineering organization for our High Voltage Direct Current product group. The HVDC technology has been on the market for over 60 years and is an enabler for renewable energy integration, supporting energy transition for a sustainable future. Please find out more about our world-leading technology at www.hitachienergy.com.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Own the technical domain “Systems” within HVDC Control & Protection Software.
* Define system architecture, requirements, and functionality to ensure usability, performance, and compliance.
* Interface with software platforms, hardware components, sub-systems, firmware, IT/OT layers, and third-party devices.
* Coordinate technical solutions and base design across domains, aligning with engineering units and stakeholders.
* Drive continuous improvement and support tender and project execution.
* Lead and mentor engineers within the Systems domain.

**Your background**

* Solid experience in HVDC control and protection software, systems or similar domains.
* Strong understanding of system-level design, architecture, integration, and testing principles.
* Extensive collaboration skills, ability to lead technically and mentor others.
* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in electrical engineering, computer science, physics, or similar field.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working hours
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various training and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Erik Kilander, erik.kilander@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Magnus Rönnholm, magnus.ronnholm@hitachienergy.com.

title: Experienced Test Engineer - Automotive sökes
description:
**Beskrivning av arbetsuppgifter:**  

Main responsibilities
  
. Responsible for Function/ System-verification according to requirements.
  
. Vehicle verification and going on Expeditions.
  
. Analysis of test results
  
. Development of future test methods (DVM)
  
. Planning and preparation of tests / test objects
  
. Participate in planning meetings.
  
. Perform requirement (Black Box), integration, regression and formal qualification testing in an agile software development process
  
. Report and document failures identified during testing
  
. Design, develop, and maintain software test plans, software test cases, software test procedures, and automated software tests in compliance with technical requirements.
  
. Work with the lead test engineer and a team of software developers to establish and develop test methods and techniques
  
. Collects test evidence that documents how the software perform during testing
  
. Documents test cases and results in a Test Case Specification and a Test Summary Report.
  
. Provides statuses to the Project and SW responsible
  
. Review software requirement specifications regarding testability
  
. Discuss technical solutions with supplier and the internal team
  
. Troubleshoot and modify test tools and test scripts
  
. Support investigations and task force activities
  
  

**Beskrivning av kvalifikationer:****Required qualifications:**  

. Bachelor or Master degree within Electrical, Computer, Engineering Physics or equivalent level of education
  
. Experience in automotive system testing
  
. Knowledge of communication protocols CAN, LIN, FlexRay and Ethernet
  
. Experience from HIL testing (Vector and/or dSpace)
  
. Experience in test tools CANalyzer/ CANoe / vTESTstudio
  
. Experience from Functional Safety, ISO26262
  
. Programming skills in C, C++, python and CAPL
  
. Experience from automation tools and processess (CI/CD, Jenkins, Robot Framework, and Git)
  
. Experience with requirement and test management tools (System Weaver and/or Elektra)
  
. Agile development processes
  
. Analytical and problem solving skills
  
. Fluent in English (written and spoken)
  
. B driving license
  
. Team player attitude
  
  

**Meritorious qualifications:**  

. Experience in Model-Based Design using MATLAB/ Simulink
  
. ISTQB Certification

title: Senior Commissioning Engineer
description:
**Company Overview**  
Hanley Energy is a multi-award-winning innovator in critical power and energy management solutions, delivering projects to a global client base. With our Global Competency Centre in Ireland and operations across Europe, the USA, Australia, South Africa, and the Nordics, Hanley Energy supports industrial manufacturing and data centre customers with end-to-end expertise — from electrical design and software controls, to commissioning, consulting, and ongoing support.

**About the Role**  
We are currently seeking an experienced **Controls Commissioning Engineer** to join our expanding international team, with a base location in **Sweden**. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of complex, high-impact projects across the Nordic region.  
As a Commissioning Engineer, you will be responsible for testing, commissioning, and final handover of control and energy monitoring systems on client sites. The role involves working closely with project teams, troubleshooting issues on site, ensuring full functionality of systems, and compiling all necessary documentation to complete the commissioning phase successfully.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Coordinate and execute testing and commissioning activities according to project specifications.
* Collaborate with Project and Operations Managers to ensure smooth project delivery.
* Identify and resolve issues in system performance or installation quality.
* Produce and review technical commissioning documentation.
* Monitor test results, compile commissioning reports, and ensure handover is completed in line with client expectations.
* Train and support global service partners in alignment with company standards.
* Provide technical support and advice to internal teams and service engineers.
* Participate in on-call support rota, including occasional evening/weekend work.
* Travel to customer sites is required — international travel within the region may also be necessary.

**Required Qualifications & Experience**

* Qualified Electrician (or equivalent technical certification).
* Minimum of 2 years' experience in installation, commissioning, repair, or servicing of **Electrical Monitoring or Control Systems (e.g., EMS/BMS)**.
* Experience with electrical instrumentation and reading electrical schematics.
* Knowledge of mechanical and electrical systems and associated communication protocols.
* Proven troubleshooting and fault-finding skills.
* Clean passport and flexibility for international travel.

**Key Skills & Competencies**

* Strong customer service and communication skills.
* Highly organised and detail oriented.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects independently.
* Analytical approach to problem-solving.
* Comfortable delivering product training to partners or clients.
* Team player with the ability to work autonomously when needed.
* Full driving license required.

**Key Behaviours**

* Professional judgment and a customer-first mindset.
* Commitment to delivering high-quality project outcomes.
* Adherence to company health and safety guidelines.
* Willingness to represent and uphold Hanley Energy’s values and culture on every site.

title: Build Engineer
description:
Are you the type of person who thrives on removing blockers, optimizing workflows, and solving complex software challenges? Your expertise will be key in ensuring smooth production processes, and no two days will be the same. If so, we might have the perfect role for you. We are looking for a Build Engineer to join our team on a hybrid basis.
  
You'll be joining a team of passionate engineers who take ownership of their work while fostering a culture of learning and collaboration. We value ambition and humility in equal measure, and we hope you do too.
  
  

**What you will do:**  

Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines, virtual environments, and infrastructure (Perforce, TeamCity, etc.).
  
Maintain and optimize build farms on-premise and in Azure.
  
Contribute to an ambitious build farm migration project, rewriting build agents with state-of-the-art technologies.
  
Write and debug automation scripts/programs in C#, PowerShell, Python, Kotlin, and more.
  
Support in-house development and production teams.
  
  

**Who you are:**  

Experienced with Windows and Linux system administration.
  
Hands-on with PC/Server hardware.
  
Proficient in programming (C#, PowerShell, Python, Java, etc.).
  
Hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or have equivalent experience.
  
Skilled in troubleshooting and research.
  
Adaptable and able to prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment.
  
Have a strong interest in system integration and game infrastructure.
  
Experienced in source control management systems as an administrator (Git, Perforce, Mercurial).
  
  

**Who we are:**  

IO Interactive is an independent videogame development and publishing company with studios in Copenhagen, Malmö, Barcelona, Istanbul and Brighton. As the creative force behind some of the most talked-about multiplatform video games in the last decade, we are committed to creating unforgettable characters and experiences – all powered by our award-winning, proprietary Glacier technology.
  
IOI is a studio that values in-person collaboration. Being together helps us focus our collective energy on our immediate goals. For us, being both in-office as well as connected across our studios helps us integrate our teams faster, strengthen relationships, and improve knowledge-sharing. We believe that the more time we spend together, the more quality and progress we achieve for our games and players.
  
We know that to achieve those goals, we need courage, talented people and a great working environment – and we do our utmost to have all of that. Across our multiple studios, we’re working on several projects. Crucially though, we’re all one team. We value the work and impact that each person brings to the table and we actively encourage new ideas, whilst listening to your insights along the way.
  
We have a dedicated team of People Managers, who look after you as an individual and as an employee. With more than 40 nationalities, we know that everyone is different and we are proud to have a reputation for being a friendly workplace with highly-talent people.
  
Learn more about our Glacier engine.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short** 




 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
 



  





**Location** 
 : Stockholm/Hybrid
 



  





 We're looking for an experienced frontend engineer to work on the migration of our web frontend platform to Next.js. This role offers an exciting opportunity to modernize our tech stack, improve performance, SEO and enhance user experience.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* Migration of our existing Java servlet and React-based SPA to a Next.js architecture
* Implementing a scalable, performant frontend solution using Next.js and React
* Collaborating with cross functional teams to ensure smooth integration of latest code
* Mentor other developers and promote best practices in modern frontend development
* Conduct code reviews and maintain high code quality standards
* Optimize application performance and implement SEO best practices
* Future proofing our frontend platform to keep us ahead of the competition
* Contribute to technical decision-making and product strategy



 Required Qualifications
 


* Expert-level knowledge of Next.js, React and its ecosystem (react-redux etc), and modern Typescript and JavaScript (ES6+)
* Strong fundamentals of web development and good debugging skills.
* Strong understanding of web performance optimization techniques and measuring tools like lighthouse, webpagetest etc
* Experience with server-side rendering and static site generation
* Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, Sass and responsive design principles
* Experience with modern frontend build tools
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Use of AI tools to write and review code



  





 Preferred Qualifications
 


* Familiarity with Java, enough to understand and refactor existing servlet code
* Experience migrating large-scale applications to modern frameworks
* Understanding of microservices and monorepo architecture Experience with containerization and cloud deployment (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Contributions to open-source projects or technical blog writing



  





***Benefits***




***So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?***



* A competitive remuneration package! 💰
* Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
* A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we’re truly Hybrid!)
* On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
* 30 paid vacation days a year
* Generous pension and insurance benefits
* Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
* Generous health subsidy benefit
* Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers



 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
 



 At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
 



 Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!

title: Senior Embedded System Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software & Platforms team with a Senior Embedded System Developer.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 As a Senior Embedded System Developer at Marshall Group, you will be navigating through the lower layers of our systems and the intricacies of controlling the hardware to bring the true rock’n’roll experience. You’ll be part of an exciting journey to build our embedded platform and development environment. You will have the opportunity to share your art of writing drivers connecting crucial components of the system, master the nuances of seamless connectivity, and navigate through layers of complexity to bring up simplicity.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Develop embedded software for audio systems.
* Architect board support packages (BSP).
* Innovate in audio-related module development.
* Implement modular code for a platform supporting a multitude of products.
* Participate in code review and documentation.
* Explore by working on proof of Concepts (PoC).
* Improve build systems and product testing.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 As a Senior Embedded System Developer, you have effective communication, a sharp problem-solving ability, and a strong sense of team collaboration. It's also important to have the ability to approach challenges with creative and innovative solutions and be ready to adapt to new technologies in a fast-paced environment. A few years' experience in a role as a Senior Embedded System Developer or similar.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* Expert-level proficiency in C
* Experience working with real-time operating systems (FreeRTOS, Zephyr, or similar)
* Previous work on embedded systems based on microcontrollers (MCU)
* Solid understanding of MCU architecture and various peripherals
* Knowledge of Python
* Familiarity with tools such as Git, Make, or CMake
* Familiarity with Bluetooth, BLE, and Wi-Fi technologies
* Bonus if you have experience with:
+ GCC toolchain, bash, and Linux
+ Knowledge of Rust and C++ programming languages


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!
